clinical_study.brief_title: USG Block of Cutaneous Nerves of the Arm
clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasound-Guided Plane Versus Conventional Block of the Medial Brachial Cutaneous and the Intercostobrachial Nervesï¼šA Retrospective Observational Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Cangzhou Hospital of Integrated Traditional Chinese and Western Medicine

clinical_study.source: Cangzhou Hospital of Integrated Traditional Chinese and Western Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: For superficial surgery of anteromedial and posteromedial surfaces of the upper arm, the medial brachial cutaneous nerve (MBCN) and the intercostobrachial nerve (ICBN) must be selectively blocked, in addition to an axillary brachial plexus block. We compared efficacy of ultrasound-guided (USG) versus conventional block of the MBCN and the ICBN.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary objective of our study was to compare the effectiveness of conventional and USG blocks of the MBCN and the ICBN in the axillary fossa. Our hypothesis was that the proportion of patients with complete anesthesia in the entire posteromedial and anteromedial surface of the arm would be greater if a USG technique were used, compared with a conventional technique. The secondary objectives were onset time of complete anesthesia, volume of local anesthetic used for the procedure, tourniquet tolerance during surgery, and ultrasound visibility of MBCN and ICBN.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with complete anesthesia
primary_outcome.time_frame: At time 20 minutes after the medial brachial cutaneous nerve and the intercostobrachial nerve block
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with complete anesthesia of the arm in region innervated by the MBCN and the ICBN

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with complete anesthesia, with reduced sensitivity and with absence of anesthesia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At times 5, 10, 15, 20 minutes after the achievement of the medial brachial cutaneous nerve block and the intercostobrachial nerve block
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with complete anesthesia, with reduced sensitivity and with absence of anesthesia at times 5, 10, 15, 20 minutes (except primary outcome) in the areas of the medial brachial cutaneous nerve and the intercostobrachial nerve
The volume (in milliliters) of 1% lidocaine used for the medial brachial cutaneous nerve and the intercostobrachial nerve block

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 hours after the achievement of the medial brachial cutaneous nerve block and the intercostobrachial nerve block
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with comfortable feeling, with unpleasant sensations and with pains during surgery, in the areas of the medial brachial cutaneous nerve and the intercostobrachial nerve

secondary_outcome.measure: Good ultrasound view of theses nerves before and after the injection of the local anesthetic
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes after the achievement of the medial brachial cutaneous nerve block and the intercostobrachial nerve block
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants (of the ultrasound-guided group) with good ultrasound view of theses nerves before and after the injection of the local anesthetic

secondary_outcome.measure: Bad ultrasound view of theses nerves before the injection and good ultrasound view of theses nerves after the injection of the local anesthetic
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes after the achievement of the medial brachial cutaneous nerve block and the intercostobrachial nerve block
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants (of the ultrasound-guided group) with bad ultrasound view of theses nerves before the injection and good ultrasound view of theses nerves after the injection of the local anesthetic

secondary_outcome.measure: Bad ultrasound view of theses nerves before and after the injection of the local anesthetic
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes after the achievement of the medial brachial cutaneous nerve block and the intercostobrachial nerve block
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants (of the ultrasound-guided group) with bad ultrasound view of theses nerves before and after the injection of the local anesthetic

intervention.description: Ultrasound-Guided Plane Block Medial Brachial Cutaneous and the Intercostobrachial Nerves
Conventional Block Medial Brachial Cutaneous and the Intercostobrachial Nerves

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Surgery of the distal upper limb : hand, forearm, lower third of the arm ,including the elbow
- Urgent or planned surgery
- Locoregional anesthesia : axillary brachial plexus block, completed by a medial brachial cutaneous nerve block and an intercostobrachial nerve block
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refused to sign informed consent
- Pregnant women
- Allergic to the local anesthetic

overall_official.affiliation: Cangzhou Hospital of Integrated Traditional Chinese and Western Medicine
